title: Prohibited Debt Collector Conduct
text: Debt collectors are prohibited from engaging in abusive, harassing, or deceptive practices.

citation: California Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (CFDCPA)
title: California Debt Collection Laws
text: California has its own debt collection laws that provide additional protections for consumers.

question: What are my rights when a debt collector contacts me?
answer: You have certain rights when a debt collector contacts you, including the right to validate the debt and to tell them to stop contacting you.

question: What can I do if a debt collector is harassing me?
answer: If a debt collector is harassing you, you can file a complaint with the appropriate regulatory agencies and consult with an attorney.

question: I keep getting calls from debt collectors about a debt I don't owe.  What should I do?
